intro: Caulinia alagnensis, commonly known as the Alagnese thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Caulinia alagnensis is typically found in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
